content.thinking: Let me analyze this document step by step according to the classification workflow: 1. **TEXT EXTRACTION** Looking at the document, I can see: - Header: "Asesorías y gestiones ambientales" (Environmental Consultancy and Management) - Text about Jaime Alexander Franco Pedraza acting as Legal Representative for the company "Asesorías y Gestiones Ambientales SAS" with NIT 900.964.285-3 - "CERTIFICA" (Certifies) - Text stating that the shareholding composition of the company is as detailed below: - Company name: "ASESORÍAS Y GESTIONES AMBIENTALES SAS" with NIT 900.964.285-3 - A table with columns: NIT, Nombre del accionista (Shareholder Name), No. De acciones (Number of shares), Capital Pagado (Paid Capital), % - Three shareholders listed: - 79770147 JAIME ALEXANDER FRANCO PEDRAZA: 20,000 shares, 20,000,000 capital, 33.33% - 51880385 MARTHA LILIA CELIS GORDO: 20,000 shares, 20,000,000 capital, 33.33% - 79958347 GIOVANNY ANDRES VEGA FORERO: 20,000 shares, 20,000,000 capital, 33.33% - Date: January 15, 2020 - Signed by Jaime Alexander Franco Pedraza as Legal Representative - Contact information at bottom 2. **PRIORITY CHECKS** This is not blank and not a link-only document. 3. **ISSUER IDENTIFICATION** This document is issued by a corporate entity (Asesorías y Gestiones Ambientales SAS), not by DIAN or Chamber of Commerce. I see this is an official certification of company ownership. The document reveals an equal three-way split among shareholders, each owning 33.33% of the company. The legal representative has documented precise details about share distribution, including individual identification numbers, share quantities, and capital contributions. The certification provides a clear snapshot of the company's ownership structure, demonstrating equal investment from three individuals. This type of document serves as an important legal record of corporate shareholding.
